verses.roman:
evaṁ vadhvāḥ pratīkṣantyā
govindāgamanaṁ nṛpa
vāma ūrur bhujo netram
asphuran priya-bhāṣiṇaḥ

synonyms: evam—thus; vadhvāḥ—the bride; pratīkṣantyāḥ—as she awaited; govinda-āgamanam—the arrival of Kṛṣṇa; nṛpa—O King (Parīkṣit); vāmaḥ—left; ūruḥ—her thigh; bhujaḥ—arm; netram—and eye; asphuran—twitched; priya—something desirable; bhāṣiṇaḥ—be speaking.
translation: O King, as the bride thus awaited the arrival of Govinda, she felt a twitch in her left thigh, arm and eye. This was a sign that something desirable would happen.
